unnormalised: ## Finding Balance: My Journey with Ayurveda Treatments
normalised: ## Finding Balance: My Journey with Ayurveda Treatments

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, lately I've been feeling a bit...off. You know, the usual hustle and bustle of city life in Mumbai – stress, pollution, late nights. My friend, Priya, suggested I try some Ayurveda treatments. I was a bit skeptical at first, but honestly, I was open to anything!
normalised: Hey everyone! So, lately I have been feeling a bit...off. You know, the usual hustle and bustle of city life in Mumbai – stress, pollution, late nights. My friend, Priya, suggested I try some Ayurveda treatments. I was a bit skeptical at first, but honestly, I was open to anything!

unnormalised: Priya recommended a place called "Kerala Ayurveda Kendra" near Bandra. She raved about their Panchakarma therapy. Now, Panchakarma sounded intimidating, but apparently, it's basically a deep cleanse designed to eliminate toxins from your body.
normalised: Priya recommended a place called "Kerala Ayurveda Kendra" near Bandra. She raved about their Panchakarma therapy. Now, Panchakarma sounded intimidating, but apparently, it is basically a deep cleanse designed to eliminate toxins from your body.

unnormalised: I started with a consultation with Dr. Sharma. He did a *prakriti* analysis to determine my dosha (vata, pitta, or kapha). Turns out, I’m predominantly pitta with a bit of vata – which explains my tendency to overheat easily! He then recommended an Abhyanga massage followed by a Shirodhara treatment.
normalised: I started with a consultation with Doctor Sharma. He did a *prakriti* analysis to determine my dosha (vata, pitta, or kapha). Turns out, I am predominantly pitta with a bit of vata – which explains my tendency to overheat easily! He then recommended an Abhyanga massage followed by a Shirodhara treatment.

unnormalised: The Abhyanga was divine! Warm, herbal-infused oil massaged all over my body. Afterwards, Shirodhara – a continuous stream of warm oil poured onto my forehead – talk about relaxing! I almost fell asleep.
normalised: The Abhyanga was divine! Warm, herbal-infused oil massaged all over my body. Afterwards, Shirodhara – a continuous stream of warm oil poured onto my forehead – talk about relaxing! I almost fell asleep.

unnormalised: Honestly, after just three sessions, I felt a HUGE difference. My sleep improved, my skin was glowing, and I felt significantly less stressed. Dr. Sharma also prescribed some herbal remedies, like Triphala and Ashwagandha, to take daily. He even gave me some diet tips tailored to my dosha, suggesting I avoid spicy foods and eat more cooling things like cucumbers and watermelon.

unnormalised: It's not a quick fix, more like a lifestyle change. I'm still learning, but so far, Ayurveda feels like a gentle, sustainable way to find balance. The cost of each session was approximately Rs. 2,500 and the Kendra itself was quite spacious, maybe around 800 sq ft. I'm definitely incorporating more Ayurvedic principles into my daily routine. Maybe next, I'll try a cooking class focusing on Ayurvedic recipes! Anyone have any recommendations for a good class in Mumbai? Let me know in the comments!
